column19:
# need to iterateAll since the ref02 might be crossmapped to bao:* values
# causing edit to end before the appropriate field is reached.
set iterateALL 1
set type_qual [getField BILLING_TAX_ID_TYPE]
set refqual "BILLING_TAX_ID_TYPE"
set error_msg "Provider ID"

set "" [validateREF02 $type_qual $error_msg]
set subID [getField SUBEIN]
if {$subID=="X0020" && $vScript!="MPA."} {
  return
}
set "" [verifyRelation $refqual $error_msg]
set qual [getField BILLING_TAX_ID_TYPE]
set len [string length $thisvalue]
if {[IsPresent] && ($vScript=="MCAR." || $vScript=="MCBRR.") && ($len!=9)} {
  setError "Employer's ID Number Must Be 9 Digits In Length."
}

If the Billing Tax Id Type (2010AA REF01) is present, the Billing Tax ID (2010AA REF02) must be present or the claim will reject. 
If this is a dakota claim and the LOB is MediPak Advantage, the Billing Tax Id (2010AA REF02) will not reject.
If the Billing Tax Id Type (2010AA REF01) is present, and this is a Medicare claim, and the Billing Tax Id Qualifier (2010AA REF01) is "EI", the Billing Tax ID must be 9 digits in this format: '999999999' '99-9999999' '99 9999999', or the claim will reject.

# need to iterateAll since the ref02 might be crossmapped to bao:* values
# causing edit to end before the appropriate field is reached.
set iterateALL 1
set type_qual [getField BILLING_SECOND_ID_TYPE:]
set refqual "BILLING_SECOND_ID_TYPE:$thisfldno"
set error_msg "Provider ID"

set "" [validateREF02 $type_qual $error_msg]

  return
}

set "" [verifyRelation $refqual $error_msg]

column30: AO. ARCAID. BAWM. BCBS. BCBSAMI. BCBSSH. BCBSX. BCMDPK. COMM. FEP. HA. ITS. MCAR. MCBRR. MPA. TYSN. USAA. USABLE. USAL.
column36:
If this is a Health Advantage, Dakota claim, and the Billing Provider NPI (2010AA NM109) is “1336337336”, the claim will not reject.

BlueCard, TYSN Employee Clinic (E8546), HealthStat Claims (E4798) and Commercial claims allow zero total charges. The total charge must be present.

If present and the total Line charges (2400 SV102) do not add up correctly, "Total Charges are out of Balance" is displayed here.

If this claim is Medicare, and the first two digits of the HCPCS code (2400 SV01-02) is ‘G8’, or the HCPCS code (2400 SV01-02) contains ‘G9142’, no further edits will be made on the claim.
If this claim is Medicare, and the first four digits of the HCPCS code (2400 SV01-02) is numeric (0-9) and the fifth digit of the HCPCS code (2400 SV01-02) is ‘F’, no further edits will be made on the claim.
If this claim is Medicare, the total charges (2300 CLM02) must be present, numeric, greater or equal to zero, and less than 99999.99 or the claim will reject.
If this claim is Medicaid, or Commercial, and the HCPCS code (2400 SV01-02) contains either ‘90663’ or ‘G9142’, no further edits will be made on the claim.
Otherwise, the total charges (2300 CLM02) must be present, numeric, greater or equal to zero or the claim will reject.
The total charges (2300 CLM02) must also be right justified.

If present the Attachment Control Number must be at least 2 characters, at most 256 characters in length. Can only contain valid characters. Valid characters are: 0-9, a-z, A-Z, -, space, comma, period, ), (, /, #, !, @, $, %, ^, &, +, =, _, \, |, ;, <, ?, {, }, [, ], and '.

column36:
If Not FEP and not Medicare Rail Road and Diag Code 1 (2300 HI01-02) is Blank and the Code (2400 SV101-2) has a value in the range of A0021 - A0999, then No Further Editing of this field is performed.

Diag Code 1 must be a valid ICD9/ICD10 code and left-justified.

If Diag Code 1 is 3 or 4 digits and a 4 or 5 digit code is available, then it must be coded to the most specific level.

INVCD,Invcd,invcd are valid codes for Access Only, Blue Advantage, Health Advantage, Blue Cross, ITS, FEP.

AMB and amb are valid codes for Blue Advantage.

Multiple occurrences of the same diagnosis code is not allowed.

Medicare, MedipakAdvantage, Medicaid and Commerical do not allow "E" priciple diagnosis codes

rendpres flag if Rendering NPI (2310B NM109) is populated, this flag is set to 'Y' otherwise, it is set to 'N'

hightcrad flag is set to 'Y' if the value in Procedure Code (2400 SV101-02) on any service line contains one of the following codes: 0000T-0200T,70000-79999,93000-93400,93600-93619,93701-93770,93875-93899,93922-93990,A9500-A9999,G0100-G0400,J0152,J0280,J1245,J1250,J2785,Q0000-Q9999,S8000-S8999

editfired flag is just to keep track of if the edit has fired once for this claim or not. This will prevent multiples of the same edit errors on one claim

radclaim flag is set to 'Y' if the value in Procedure Code (2400 SV101-02) on any service line contains one of the following codes: 
0000T-0200T,70000-79999,93000-93400,93600-93619,93701-93770,93875-93899,93922-93990,A9500-A9999,G0100-G0400,J0152,J0280,J1245,J1250,J2785,Q0000-Q9999,S8000-S8999

column30: BAWM. BCBS. BCBSAMI. BCBSSH. BCBSX. HA. ITS. TYSN. USABLE.
column36:
Beginning on October 16, 2016, all Ambulance claims must have, at least, a 5-digit zip code in the Ambulance pick up loop (2310E N4) for Point of Pick-up. If it is an ambulance water or air(42) and the zip code is not a valid Arkansas zip code, the claim will reject. These claims must be filed to the Blue plan whose service area the point of pick up zip code is located.

2016089035 - rmt - 04/14/2016 - remove some Tyson submitters from air ambulance requirement
2016071031 - rmt - 10/16/2016 - add land ambulance

Ambulance Pick Up Location Zip (2310E N403) is required when any portion of the 2310E segment is present, except Country Code (2010E N404). Ambulance Pick Up Location Zip must be valid for the given Ambulance Pick Up Location State (2010E N402).

column30: ARCAID. COMM. FEP. MCAR. MCBRR. MPA. USAA.
column36:
Adjustment Reason Code (2320 CAS02) is Required When Adjustment Amount (2320 CAS03) is Present
For FEP, Medicare and Medipak Advantage:
  The Adjustment Reason Code Must be a Valid Code for the Check/Remittance Date (2330B DTP 573).
  If the Claim Level Check/Remittance Date is not Present, the Adjustment Reason Code Must Be Valid for the High/Low Range of the Line Level Check/Remittance Date (2430 DTP 573).
  If the Adjustment Reason Code is present, a Check/Remit Date is required.

column30: AO. BAWM. BCBS. BCBSAMI. BCBSSH. BCBSX. FEP. HA. ITS. TYSN. USAA. USABLE. USAL.
column36:
Claims with DOS on or after 4/1/2013 submitted from providers with Medicare primary and cob information populated must use CARC code 223 if date submitted to AHIN is 1/5/2014 and earlier and must use CARC code 253 if date submitted to AHIN is 1/6/2014 and later.

The ASC X12 Committee has approved Claim Adjustment Reason Code (CARC) 253, defined as "Sequestration-reduction in federal payments," to be effective June 2, 2013.
Implementation of CARC 253 will not occur, however, until January 6, 2014.
Therefore, CARC 253 will replace CARC 223 (defined as "Adjustment code for mandated Federal, State or Local law/regulation that is not already covered by another by another code and is mandated before a new code can be created") on all outbound COBA crossover claims that Medicare creates and then sends to our COB Contractor (COBC) beginning January 6, 2014.

2014080027 - rmt - 03/24/2014 - first implementation
2015085016 - rmt - 03/26/2015 - use dos and date of submission

When Adjustment Reason Code (2320 CAS02) is Present the Adjustment Amount (2320 CAS03) is Required.
For Medicare and Medipak Advantage, the Adjustment Amount:
 Must be Numeric
 Must be >= -99,999.99 and <= 99,999.99
 Must Not Equal 0
 Limited to 0, 1, or 2 Decimal Places

2010/07/20--DMC--Added "set iterateALL 1" per Protrac 2010193031.
2010316003 - 11/18/2010 - SLC - adjust for Medicare & Medipak Advantage 5010
2011063009-03/24/2011-rmp-commented out adj 1 required when adj reason 1 present

2013200011 - 07/24/2013 - slc - added Medicare Part B Railroad Payer to edit for baseline

If Present, Adjustment Quantity (2430 CAS04) Must Not Be 0, Must Be Numeric, and Cannot Exceed 15 Digits.

Therefore, CARC 253 will replace CARC 223 (defined as "Adjustment code for mandated Federal, State or Local law/regulation that is not already covered by another by another code and is mandated before a new code can be created") on all outbound COBA crossover claims that Medicare creates and then sends to our COB Contractor (COBC) beginning January 6, 2014.

column36:
This is the initial COB edit for Professional 5010.
If the claim is TYSN Employee Clinic (E8546), HealthStat, E4467 (Integrated Settlement), MCD2 or FEP Paper we do not edit.
If the claim is paper, indicated by submitter id of ‘X0020’ and the subscriber is S or T, we edit for an attachment type of ‘EB’.
If the subscriber is S or T or the claim is for Medipak, Payer Name (2330B NM103) is required.  A function is called to determine if a complete COB loop exists at either the line or the claim level and flags are set respectively. If a complete COB loop exists then no further editing is done. If neither exists, messages are displayed saying that a complete COB loop is required and we highlight the fields of the COB Claim Loop.

2018073022 - 03/26/2018 - slc - 92250 cpt requirements.

Procedure Code (2400 SV101-02 FA0_HCPCS) must be present and length of 5.

For Medicaid, the following HCPCS values are invalid:
C0000 through C9999
K0000 through K9999
For Medicaid, allow procedure code 80101 and J7302 and reject G0434, J7298 and J7297.

HCPCS must be a valid code on the Date of Service (2400 DTP03) on the claim.

For Medicare, claims with Service From date (2400 DTP03) on or after January 1, 2011 can no longer be submitted with CPT 90658. These claims should be filed with Appropriate code from range Q2035-Q2039.

For Medicare, Q0000-Q9999 are valid values.

column30: AO. BAWM. BCBS. BCBSAMI. BCBSSH. BCBSX. BCMDPK. FEP. HA. ITS. MPA. SIM. TYSN. USAA. USABLE. USAL.
column36:
Code (2400 SV101-02) is required, except for ITS paper claims.
Code must be Length of 5, and be a valid HCPCS code for the given Service Dates (2400 DTP03) as stated in the current CPT/HCPCS manual (with the following exceptions):
  -HealthAdvantage, Medipak Advantage, USABLE, and BlueAdvantage allow INVCD, invcd and invcd.
  -HealthAdvantage, Medipak Advantage, BCMedipak and BCBS do not allow 90701, use 90700 instead.

HealthFair (submitter E6711) can only submit the following HCPCS codes: G0202, 77052, 80061, 82947 and 85025 for Tyson members.

For MPA, claims with Service From date (2400 DTP03) on or after January 1, 2011 can no longer be submitted with CPT 90658. These claims should be filed with Appropriate code from range Q2035-Q2039.

For MPA, Q0000-Q9999 are valid values.

All Lines of Business will allow H0031, H0032, H2012, H2019 and H2020 on or after 10/1/2011.
All Lines of Business will allow K0010-K0014, K0606-K0609, and K0800-K0899 on or after 1/1/2014.

Doctor on Demand can only submit the following codes: 99201-99203,99211-99213,90832,90834,90837,90791 && year =< 2018,90792 && year >= 2019. These must have a GT modifier. Doctor on Demand (submitter E3397) can only submit claims for WalMart, Tyson and Navistar members. 

For BA (USABLE), BCBS, BCBSX, BCBSAMI, HA MDLive "E7571" only allows HCPCS "99441-99444,90791,90832,90834,90847,90792,90833,90836,90838,99213-99215"

09/28/2007-RMP-PR2007235007 - remove K code edit from FEP

Mod 1 must be alpha numeric, no special characters, and two characters long.
Mod 1 is validated against the list of valid modifiers.

The Line Charge may be zero if the first two digits of the HCPCS code (2400 SV01-02) is ‘G8’, OR the first four digits of the HCPCS code (2400 SV01-02) are numeric, and the fifth digit is ‘F’.

Also, the Line Charge (2400 SV102) may be zero if the HCPCS code (2400 SV01-02) contains values G8348-G8368,G8485-G8488,G9063-G9075,G9077-G9080,G9083-G9117,G9123-G9126,G9128-G9139,G9142.

Otherwise, the Line Charge (2400 SV102) must be present, numeric, >= $0, and must be less than or equal to $99,999.99.

MPA does not require the line charge to be greater than zero.

column36:
Anesthesia Minutes (2400 SV104 MJ qualifier) or Service Units (2400 SV104 UN qualifier) are Required.

Service Units must be greater than 0, and no further editing if Procedure Code (2400 SV101)matches the pattern of [0-9][0-9][0-9][0-9][A-Z].

Procedure Codes 00100-01995,01997-01999 must have Anesthesia Minutes (2400 SV104 MJ qualifier).

Procedure Codes not in 00100-01995,01997-01999 cannot have Anesthesia Minutes.

Procedure Codes must be Numeric for Anesthesia Minutes.

Anesthesia/Oxygen Minutes must be Numeric.

For Dakota claims, Anesthesia Minutes must be greater than 1. Service Units must be greater than 0.

For non-Dakota claims, Anesthesia Minutes must be greater than 0.

If Medicare, Commercial or Medipak Advantage, Service Units (2400 SV104 UN qualifier) must be greater than 0, must be Numeric, must be less than or equal to 9999.9, and can have up to 3 decimal places.
Anesthesia/Oxygen Minutes (2400 SV104 MJ qualifier) must be greater than 0, must be Numeric, must be less than or equal to 9999, and can have up to 3 decimal places.

If Not Medicare, Commercial or Medipak Advantage, then Service Units must be greater than 0, must be Numeric, and Decimals are not allowed. Anesthesia/Oxygen Minutes must be Numeric, Decimals not allowed, must be greater than 0, and must be less than 9999.

Anesthesia/Oxygen Minutes or Service Units is required for Medicare and Medipak Advantage.

If HCPCS code (2400 SV101-02) is 99281-99285,99288, the Place of Service (2400 SV105) must be 23.

When Place of Service (2400 SV105) is not present but the Place of Service (2300 CLM05-01) at the claim is present, and HCPCS code (2400 SV101-02) is 59400, the Place of Service  (2300 CLM05-01) must be 21 or 25.

When Place of Service (2400 SV105) is not present but the Place of Service (2300 CLM05-01) at the claim is present, and HCPCS code (2400 SV101-02) is 99281-99285,99288, the Place of Service  (2300 CLM05-01) must be 23.

Date Of Service must be on or after the Effective Date of the Plan.

The Service From Date is a required field.

If Service From Date is not formatted correctly, then "Service From Date Missing\Invalid" is displayed.

If Service From Date is before the Patient's birth date (2010CA DMG02), then "Service From Date Found To Be Less Than Patient Birth" is displayed.
    
If Service From Date is after the system date, then "Service From Date Cannot Be a Future Date" is displayed.

If Sevice From and To Dates have different years, then "Dates of Svc For Different Years Cannot Be Filed On Same Claim. Separate By Year And Resubmit" is displayed.

This edit ONLY applies to Dakota paper HUKI claims.  

Only one line level Notes TPO Text (2400 NTE02) segment should be created per line by the Dakota system.
Below is the Layout of the Notes TPO Text (NTE02) field at the 2400 loop.

The Notes TPO Text field(2400 NTE-02) should start with “JP” in the first two positions of this field followed by the tooth number for three bytes.  The Tooth Surface which occurs 5 times for two bytes each will complete the NTE-02 field.

The tooth numbers values are:  1 through 32 and A through T.   
The tooth surface values are:  B, D, F, I, L, M and O.    – These should be left justified.

column36:
When present, the National Drug Code (2410 LIN03) field must be alphanumeric and 11 digits.
For commercial payers, the NDC must be valid on the date of service of the claim.

For Medicare, Medicaid, MedipakAdvantage and Commerical payers, When Prescription Number (2410 REF02) is present, the National Drug Code (2410 LIN03) must also be present.

When Unit of Measure (2410 CTP05) is "F2", the Unit Count (2410 CTP04) cannot be > 9999999. 

When Unit of Measure (2410 CTP05) is "UN", the Unit Count (2410 CTP04) cannot be > 999999.9. 

When Unit of Measure (2410 CTP05) is "GR" or "ML", the Unit Count (2410 CTP04) cannot be > 99.99.

Unit Count (2410 CTP04) is required when National Drug Code (2410 LIN03) is present.

Unit Count (2410 CTP04) is required when Unit of Measure (2410 CTP05) is present.

Unit Count is required when the National Drug Code (2410 LIN03) is present.

Unit Count is required when the Unit of Measure (2410 CPT05) is present.

If Unit Count (2410 CTP04) is present, must be > 0, <= 9,999,999.999, and must not exceed 3 decimal places.

column30: BAWM. BCBS. BCBSAMI. BCBSSH. BCBSX. FEP. HA. ITS. TYSN. USAA. USABLE. USAL.
column36:
If a BAA claim (PYR_ORG_ID='011B63','000002','0119C7','0119C8') and it is a Paper Claim (Submitter Number = 'x0020' 1000A NM109) DO NOT EDIT

if (USABLE, BCBS, BCBSX, BCBSAMI, or HA) and MDLive (Subid E7571) do not edit.

if (TYSN) and SUBID E8546 do not edit.

if subid E7674 and BillNPI 1245403567 do not edit.

If claim contains high tech radiology procedure codes (70336,70450-70555,71250-71555,72125-72159,72191-72198,73200-73225,73700-73725,74150-74185,74261-74263,75557-75574,75635,76093,76094,76380,76390,76400,77058,77059,77084,78451,78459,78465-78469,78481-78492,78499,78608,78609,7811-78816,0042T,G0235,S8037,S8042) OR is of a specialty type Radiation Therapy (payspec='031') or (payspec='0TM') or Sleep Study (payspec='0SS') OR if the Facility Type POS (2300 CLM05-01) is Independant Lab ('81) DO NOT EDIT

If Pay to Specialty is an Imaging center ('0IC') AND the claim contains lines with radiology procedure codes (0000T-0200T,70000-79999,93000-93400,93600-93619,93701-93770,93875-93899,93922-93990,A9500-A9999,G0100-G0400,J0152,J0280,J1245,J1250,J2785,Q0000-Q9999,S8000-S8999) AND the Pay to type is a Clinic AND the Facility Type POS (2300 CLM05-01) is an office ('11') or an Independent clinic ('49') DO NOT EDIT

If Pay to type is 'D' (determined by SP) then there is a Home Infusion or DME specialty involved DO NOT EDIT

If Pay to type is 'B' it means that this NPI has both a listing as a clinic and a individual. If the Rendering information is present at either the claim (2310B NM109) or the line level (2420A NM109) then the Pay to NPI is treated as a Clinic and follows the regular flow detailed below, else the NPI is treated as an individual and follows flow below

REGULAR FLOW:
Pay to type is 'C' for Clinic, Rendering NPI(2420A NM109) is present, the invalid flag (returned by SP) is 'Y', then the provider affiliation does not exist. Regardless, if the Rendering type is a Clinic, Facility or Group it is invalid
ELSE if the pay to type is a 'C' and no Rendering info exists at either the claim (2310B NM109) or the line level (2420A NM109) then the claim is in error, ELSE if the claim level rendering info exists and the invalid flag is 'Y' the affiliation is in conflict.

Pay to type is 'P' for Individual, and Rendering NPI(2420A NM109) is present, the Rendering has to be equal to the Billing NPI(2010AA NM109) or the rendering type has to be "I" for Individual if the invalid flag (from SP) equals 'Y' the affiliation does not exist.
ELSE the claim level Rendering NPI(2420A NM109) must equal the Billing NPI(2010AA NM109) or be type "I". If the invalid flag (from SP) equals 'Y' the affiliation does not exist.

If present, Modifier 1 must be a valid HCPCS Modifier.

column30: AO. BAWM. BCBS. BCBSAMI. BCBSSH. BCBSX. FEP. HA. ITS. TYSN. USAA. USABLE. USAL.
column36:
Claims with DOS on or after 4/1/2013 submitted from providers with Medicare primary and cob information populated must use CARC code 223 if date submitted to AHIN is 1/5/2014 and earlier and must use CARC code 253 if date submitted to AHIN is 1/6/2014 and later.

The ASC X12 Committee has approved Claim Adjustment Reason Code (CARC) 253, defined as "Sequestration-reduction in federal payments," to be effective June 2, 2013.
Implementation of CARC 253 will not occur, however, until January 6, 2014.
Therefore, CARC 253 will replace CARC 223 (defined as "Adjustment code for mandated Federal, State or Local law/regulation that is not already covered by another by another code and is mandated before a new code can be created") on all outbound COBA crossover claims that Medicare creates and then sends to our COB Contractor (COBC) beginning January 6, 2014.

2015085016 - rmt - 03/26/2015 - use dos and date of submission

 Must be >= -99,999,999.99 and <= 99,999,999.99
 Must Not Equal 0
 Limited to 0, 1, or 2 Decimal Places

column36:
Claims with DOS on or after 4/1/2013 submitted from providers with Medicare primary and cob information populated must use CARC code 223 if date submitted to AHIN is 1/5/2014 and earlier and must use CARC code 253 if date submitted to AHIN is 1/6/2014 and later.

The ASC X12 Committee has approved Claim Adjustment Reason Code (CARC) 253, defined as "Sequestration-reduction in federal payments," to be effective June 2, 2013.
Implementation of CARC 253 will not occur, however, until January 6, 2014.
Therefore, CARC 253 will replace CARC 223 (defined as "Adjustment code for mandated Federal, State or Local law/regulation that is not already covered by another by another code and is mandated before a new code can be created") on all outbound COBA crossover claims that Medicare creates and then sends to our COB Contractor (COBC) beginning January 6, 2014.

When Submitter Contact Qualifier 2 is TE, EX or FX, Submitter Contact Number 2 must be numeric. When Submitter Contact Qualifier 2 is TE or FX, Submitter Contact Number 2 must be length of 10. column36:
If claim is secondary Medicare, there must be one Payer Amount Paid present, or the claim will reject.
If claim is secondary Medicare, there cannot be more than one Payer Amount Paid present, or the claim will reject.
If claim is Medicare or MediPak Advantage and Payer Sequence Number (2000B, SBR01) is not present, claim will reject.
If claim is Medicare or MediPak Advantage and Payer Sequence Number (2000B, SBR01) does not contain ‘P’ or ‘S’, claim will reject.
If claim is Medicare or MediPak Advantage and Payer Sequence Number (2000B, SBR01) contains ‘S’, and none of the Payer Responsibility (2320, SBR01) fields contain a ‘P’, claim will reject.

Otherwise, if claim is not Medicare or MediPak Advantage, the  Payer Sequence Number (2000B, SBR01) must contain A,B,C,D,E,F,G,H,P,S, or T, or claim will reject.

02/10/2009-DMC-Created per 5010 Implementation.

Adjudication Date (2330B DTP03 or 2430 DTP03) is required at the claim level or the line level when Claim Payer Responsibility (2000 SBR01) is NOT Primary, Other Subscriber Payer Responsibility (2320 SBR01) is Primary, SBR09 is MA or MB (indicating Medicare is the primary payer). When Medicare is primary, the Adjudication Date must be 30 or more days from the Medicare remittance date (claim receipt date).

Patient Relationship Indicator (2000B SBR02) is required and must be Valid Value: 01,18,19,20,21,39,40,53,G8
Subscriber Name (2010BA) must be the subscriber on the policy.
If Patient Relationship is SELF (18) the Subscriber (2010BA) information listed below MUST MATCH the Patient (2010CA) information:
Last Name
First Name
Date of Birth
Member ID Number
If Patient Relationship is NOT SELF at least 1 of the following values should NOT MATCH the Subscriber Information:
Last Name
First Name
Date of Birth
For FEP, the Patient and Subscriber ID must match when Patient Relationship is NOT SELF.

If present, Total Charge (2300 CLM02) must equal the sum of the Charge Amt (2400 SV203) from each line, or the claim will reject.
Total Charge (2300 CLM02) is required, must be numeric, and greater than zero.
Total Charge (2300 CLM02) can be zero when:
 -Procedure Code (2400 SV202-2) is G8000-G8999, 1060F-6020F, 0001F-9999F and claim is for Medicare
 -Procedure Code (2400 SV202-2) is 90663 or G9142 and claim is not for Medicare
 -Billtype (2300 CLM05-01) is 322 or 332 and Revenue Code (2400 SV201) is 0023 is the only Revenue Code on the claim and claim is for ITS or MPA.
Total Charge (2300 CLM02) cannot be greater than 99,999,999.99.

column36:
The Bill Type (2300 CLM05) must be present, 3 Characters Long and pass the following rules:
The first position must be 1-4, 6-8.
Valid combinations for first and second positions are: 11,12,13,14,18,21,22,23,28,32,34,41,43,65,66,71,72,73,74,75,76,77,78,79,81,82,83,84,85,86,89.
When first and second positions are: 11,12,13,14,18,21,22,23,28,71-79,84-86,89, the Third Character Must Be 0-5, 7, 8, O, Q, Or X-Z.
When first and second positions are: 32,34, the Third Character Must Be 0-5, 7-9, A, O, Q, Or X-Z.
When first and second positions are: 41,43, the Third Character Must Be 0-5, 7-9, A-B, D, O, Q, Or X-Z.
When first and second positions are: 65,66, the Third Character Must Be 0-5, 7, 8, F-K, M-P, Q, Or X-Z.
When first and second positions are: 81,82, the Third Character Must Be 0-5, 7, 8, A-E, O, Q, Or X-Z.
When first and second positions are: 83, the Third Character Must Be 0-5, 7, 8, A, O, Q, Or X-Z.

if {[CWL "20,40,41,42"]} {
   set iterateALL 1
   set flag 0
   set occ1 [getField "OCCCD1:1"]
   set occ2 [getField "OCCCD2:1"]
   set occ3 [getField "OCCCD3:1"]
   set occ4 [getField "OCCCD4:1"]
   set occ5 [getField "OCCCD5:1"]
   set occ6 [getField "OCCCD6:1"]
   set occ7 [getField "OCCCD7:1"]
   set occ8 [getField "OCCCD8:1"]
   set occ9 [getField "OCCCD9:1"]
   set occ10 [getField "OCCCD10:1"]
   set occ11 [getField "OCCCD11:1"]
   set occ12 [getField "OCCCD12:1"]
   set occ1b [getField "OCCCD1:2"]
   set occ2b [getField "OCCCD2:2"]
   set occ3b [getField "OCCCD3:2"]
   set occ4b [getField "OCCCD4:2"]
   set occ5b [getField "OCCCD5:2"]
   set occ6b [getField "OCCCD6:2"]
   set occ7b [getField "OCCCD7:2"]
   set occ8b [getField "OCCCD8:2"]
   set occ9b [getField "OCCCD9:2"]
   set occ10b [getField "OCCCD10:2"]
   set occ11b [getField "OCCCD11:2"]
   set occ12b [getField "OCCCD12:2"]

   set occ_str ",$occ1,$occ2,$occ3,$occ4,$occ5,$occ6,$occ7,$occ8,$occ9,$occ10,$occ11,$occ12,$occ1b,$occ2b,$occ3b,$occ4b,$occ5b,$occ6b,$occ7b,$occ8b,$occ9b,$occ10b,$occ11b,$occ12b,"
   if { [regexp {55} $occ_str]==0 } {
      setError "Occurrence Code 55 (Date of Death) Required For This Patient Status Code"
   }

WHEN THE VALUE CODE IS A0, PROVIDERS MUST REPORT THE PICK UP ZIP CODE IN THE DOLLAR PORTION OF THE FIELD.

WHEN THE VALUE CODE IS A0, THE VALUE AMOUNT MUST BE EITHER 5 OR 9 DIGITS.  

IF ANYTHING OTHER THAN 00 IS TO THE RIGHT OF THE DECIMAL REJECT THE CLAIM BACK TO THE PROVIDER

Beginning October 16, 2016, BlueCard Ambulance claims (revenue code 054x,  x represents all valid values 0, 2, 3, etc) require a 5-digit zip code in the Value Amount (2300 HI01) and A0 (2300 HI01) in the Value Code. If rev code is 0545 and the zip code is not a valid Arkansas zip code, the claim will reject. These claims must be filed to the Blue plan whose service area the point of pick up zip code is located.

Do not allow multiple occurrences of the same condition code.

column30: AO. ARCAID. BAWM. BCBS. COMM. FEP. HA. ITS. MCAR. USAA. USABLE. USAL. TYSN. BCBSX. BCBSAMI. BCBSSH.
column36:
If the Attending Provider’s Second Id Qualifier (2310A REF01) is present the Attending Provider’s Second Id (2310A REF02) must be present, or the claim will reject.

If the Attending Provider’s Second Id (2310A REF02) is present the Attending Provider’s Second Id Qualifier (2310A REF01) must be present, or the claim will reject.

If present, and a Medicare claim, the Attending Provider’s Secondary ID Number (2310A REF02)must be in the following format: ANNNNN or AAANNN (where A is an alpha character and N is a number) or the claim will reject.
If present and a Medicare claim, the Attending Provider’s Second Id (2310A REF02) must be six digits in length, or the claim will reject.

column36:
Claims with DOS on or after 4/1/2013 submitted from providers with Medicare primary and cob information populated must use CARC code 223 if date submitted to AHIN is 1/5/2014 and earlier and must use CARC code 253 if date submitted to AHIN is 1/6/2014 and later.

The ASC X12 Committee has approved Claim Adjustment Reason Code (CARC) 253, defined as "Sequestration-reduction in federal payments," to be effective June 2, 2013.
Implementation of CARC 253 will not occur, however, until January 6, 2014.
Therefore, CARC 253 will replace CARC 223 (defined as "Adjustment code for mandated Federal, State or Local law/regulation that is not already covered by another by another code and is mandated before a new code can be created") on all outbound COBA crossover claims that Medicare creates and then sends to our COB Contractor (COBC) beginning January 6, 2014.

2014080027 - rmt - 03/24/2014 - first implementation
2015085016 - rmt - 03/26/2015 - use dos and date of submission

The Adjustment Amount:
 is Required when the 2320 CAS Segment is Present.
 Must be Numeric
 Must be >= -99,999,999.99 and <= 99,999,999.99
 Must Not Equal 0
 Limited to 0, 1, or 2 Decimal Places

If Present, the Remaining Patient Liability Amount (2320 AMT02 EAF) Must Be Numeric, >= $0, <= $99,999,999.99. For Medicare and Medipak Advantage, Remaining Patient Liability Amount Can Not Exceed 2 Decimal Places.

2010316003 - 11/17/2010 - slc - 5010:Medicare & MPA Edit Requirements

If Present, the Total Non-Covered Amount (2320 AMT02 A8) Must Be Numeric, >= $0, <= $99,999,999.99. 
For Medipak Advantage, Total Non-Covered Amount Can Not Exceed 2 Decimal Places.
For Medicare, Do not send Non-Covered Amount.

column30: BAWM. BCBS. BCBSAMI. BCBSSH. BCBSX. BCMDPK. FEP. HA. TYSN. USAA. USABLE. USAL.
column36:
This is the initial COB edit for Institutional 5010. If the subscriber has multiple Blue on Blue Policies and any of them are P, we do not edit at this time.
If the claim is MCD2, we do not edit.
If the claim is a paper claim, indicated by submitter id of ‘X0020’ and the subscriber is S or T, we edit for an attachment type of ‘EB’.
If the subscriber is S or T or the claim is a BCMDPK the following fields are required: Payer Name (2330 NM103). A function is called to determine if a complete COB loop exists at either the line or the claim level and flags are set respectively. If a complete COB loop exists then no further editing is done. If neither exists, messages are displayed saying that a complete COB loop is required and we highlight the fields of the COB Claim Loop. 

2011252005 - 9/12/2011 - FMB - for outpatient claims and the following lines of business, do not edit HA, FEP, BAWM, USABLE, USAL, USAA, BCBS
2011257016 - 9/15/2011 - FMB - For outpatient claims for HA, FEP, BAWM, USABLE, USAL, USAA, BCBS, look at the Prof COB indicator to determine whether or not the claim should be edited. If prof ind is P, do not edit, if anything else, edit.
2011304001 - 11/8/11 - FMB - added hearing aid flag, if hearing aid code is present (determined by edit 3311) then don't edit for HA, FEP, BCBS, BCMDPK
2011336004 - 12/9/2011 - FMB - Added functionality that will check to see if amount paid at either claim or line level cob is 0.00, if it is, then CAS will be required. Uses edits 3320 and 3321.
2012024016 - 11/26/2012 - FMB - Added functionality that will ignore claims from E4467 (Integrated Settlement BOB claims)
2012095015 - 04/13/2012 - RMT - Remove exclusion requirement of Claim.Multi-Y and
2012292012 - 10/22/2012 - slc - added Tyson to edit for baseline
2013123008 - 05/03/2013 - slc - added Exchange Payers to edit for baseline
2013140007 - 05/22/2013 - slc - added Exchange Shop Payer to edit for baseline

If Assignment of Benefits (2320 OI03) is present, it must be N, Y, or W.
Assignment of Benefits (2320 OI03) is required when the 2320 loop is present.

02/06/2009-DMC-Revised per 5010 Implementation.
2010316003-11/12/2010-RMP-updated MCAR/MPA requirements.
2015035023 - 02/12/2015 - rmt - included Medicaid in requiring OI

This edit was created to set a flag for hearing aid HCPC codes. If a hearing aid HCPC is present on a claim, a flag is set so that we can return out of edit 3256 for COB editing. LOBs excluded from this check are BAA and MPAK


2011304001 - 11/1/11 - FMB - initial creation.

When Other Payer Second Id Qualifier (2330B REF01) is present, Other Payer Second Id (2330B REF02) must be present. 
For Medicare and Medipak Advantage only, when Other Payer Second Id Qualifier is EI, Other Payer Second Id must be length of 9 and contain only numbers. Also, when Other Payer Second Id Qualifier is 2U, FY or NF, Other Payer Second Id cannot exceed length of 50 and must contain only valid characters. Valid characters are: 0-9, a-z, A-Z, -, space, comma, period, ), (, /, #, !, @, $, %, ^, &, +, =, _, \, |, ;, <, ?, {, }, [, ], and '.

column36:
If the Revenue Code is not valid, the message "'$thisvalue' Is Not A Valid Revenue Code" will display.
Revenue codes 0905, 0906, 0912, 0913 and 0915 will require one of the following CPT codes: 
90801-90829, 90846-90862, 90870, 90880,90901, 96101-96103, 96118-96120, G0176-G0177, G0396-G0397, G0410-G0411, S9480, and S0201
After December 31, 2012, Revenue codes 0905, 0906, 0912, 0913 and 0915 will also require one of the following CPT codes: 90785, 90791-90792, 90832-90834, 90836-90840, 90863.

Revenue code 0761 will require one of the following CPT codes: 99201-99205, 99211-99215, 97597, 97598, 97602, 96523 for outpatient claims. G0463 is valid after 12/31/2013.

If Revenue code 0761 is present AND Revenue codes 0270, 0271 and/or 0272 are also present, 0270, 0271 and/or 0272 will require a CPT/HCPCS from the following list:
A4216-A4217, A4244, A4246, A4248-A4456, A4461-A4465, A4470, A4480, A4490-A4510, A4565, A4570, A6000-A6550, A9999, Q4100-Q4116, for outpatient claims.

Outpatient claims with Revenue Code 0942 or 0636 require HCPCS/CPT code.
Outpatient claims with Revenue Code 0480-0489, 0440-0449, 0420-0429, or 0430-0439 require HCPCS/CPT code.

Outpatient claims with Revenue Codes 0275 or 0278 will require an Invoice Amount (2400 HCP01 and 2400 HCP02), ONLY if the Date of Service is less than 01/01/2018.

Effective 06/01/2013, Birthing Centers will be restricted to billing only revenue code 0724 and must have a CPT/HCPCS in the range of 59400-59430. The Bill Type accepted from this provider specialty will be 84X.

When the following Outpatient Claim field values exist:
- Bill Type (2300 CLM0501) = "13X" or "85X"
- Admission Type (2300 CL101) = "1"(ER), "2"(URGENT), or "5"(TRAUMA)
- Revenue Code (2400 SV201) = "045X", "0516", "0526", or "0762"
The Patient Reason for Visit field must be present. Otherwise, the error message "Valid Patient Reason For Unscheduled Outpatient Visit is Required" is displayed.

This edit uses global variable PATRVFLAG to determine whether or not to check the values in Revenue Codes at the Service Line Level, since the other fields are at the Claim Level. Only the first Revenue Code "hit" will trigger the error message, even though there can be up to 50 Revenue Codes.

851 - 90989, 90993, 90945, 90947

column30: AO. BAWM. BCBS. BCBSX. FEP. HA. ITS. TYSN. USAA. USABLE.
column36:
4.	For Access Only, ABCBS, Exchange, BlueCard, FEP, HA, Health Advantage and BlueAdvantage. Wal-Mart, Tyson and USAA and Usable
a.	If bill type is equal to 210-217, Service from (2300 DTP03) is equal to 10/01/2019 or greater:
b.	Require at least one occurrence of the Revenue Code (2400 SV201 REVCD) equal to 0022, if revenue code not present, display error message “SNF claim is required to have revenue code “0022”
c.	Require PDPM code to be present in the HCPCS field (2400 SV202 HCPCS), when (2400 SV202 Service ID QUAL) equal to “HP” and if HCPCS code not present, display error message “PDPM code Required for Revenue code 0022”
d.	Compare PDPM (2400 SV202 HCPCS) code, the first 4 characters of the code to the table using the Service dates (2400 DTP03) if present, if not present, the PDPM code must be valid for the Statement from and Statement to dates (2300 DTP03) if not, display error message “Invalid PDPM code for Service Date”
e.	If the PDPM code (2400 SV202 HCPCS) exceeds 4 characters, the 5th character must equal 0, 1 or 6, if not one of these values, claim should encounter error; display error message “5th character of PDPM code is not valid”
f.	If the Statement from Date (2300 DTP03 STMTFR) is less than 10/01/2019 and Statement to (2300 DTP03 STMTO) is greater than or equal to 10/01/2019; claim should encounter error and display message “This claim needs to be refiled with all charges on or after 10/1/2019 submitted on a separate claim”


2019158012 - mdf - 09/12/2019 - Req PDPM HIPPS for Skilled Nursing Fac

If Billtype (2300 CLM05-1) is 211-219, there is no further validation.
For Medicare, If HCPCS (2400 SV202) is one of the following: C0000-C9999,Q0000-Q9999,G0000-G9999, there is no further validation.
For Medipak Advantage, If HCPCS (2400 SV202) is one of the following: Q0000-Q9999, there is no further validation.
If 2400 SV202 is a valid CMG code no further validation.

If Prod/Id Qual (2400 SV202-1) = HP and Revenue Code (2400 SV201) = 0022, Procedure Code (2400 SV202-2) must be a valid RUG code for the Service From (2400 DTP03) and Service To (2400 DTP03) dates. If the Service dates are not present, the Code must be valid for the Statement From (2300 DTP03) and Statement To (2300 DTP03) dates.  Reference the NUBC Manual For Valid Codes.

If Prod/Id Qual (2400 SV202-1) = HP and Revenue Code (2400 SV201) = 0023, Procedure Code (2400 SV202-2) must be a valid HRG code for the Service From (2400 DTP03) and Service To (2400 DTP03) dates. If the Service dates are not present, the Code must be valid for the Statement From (2300 DTP03) and Statement To (2300 DTP03) dates.  Reference the NUBC Manual For Valid Codes.

Procedure Code must be a valid HCPCS code for the Service Dates and/or Statement Dates.

2008137014 - allow C, Q, and G codes.

column30: AO. ARCAID. BAWM. BCBS. BCBSAMI. BCBSSH. BCBSX. BCMDPK. COMM. FEP. HA. ITS. TYSN. USAA. USABLE. USAL.
column36:
Service Dates (2400 DTP03 SVCDATE) equal to 1/1/2019 and greater and Bill Type is equal (2300 CLM05 BILLTYPE) to 210 through 217 for Access Only, ABCBS, Exchange, BlueCard, FEP, HA, Health Advantage and BlueAdvantage. Wal-Mart, Tyson and USAA and Usable; 
•	Require at least one occurrence of Revenue Code (2400 SV201 REVCD) equal to 0022, if revenue code not present, Display Error Message “SNF claim is required to have revenue code 0022”
•	Require RUG code to be present in the HCPCS field (2400 SV202 HCPCS)
•	If RUG code is not present, Display Error Message “RUG-IV Code Required for Revenue code 0022”

For BCBS and BlueCross Medipak claims, if revenue codes 0022 - 0024, and bill type 2XX bypass RUG code editing.

For Medicaid, allow procedure code 80101 and J7302 and reject G0434, J7298 and J7297.

If Prod/Id Qual (2400 SV202-1) = HP and Revenue Code (2400 SV201) = 0022, Procedure Code (2400 SV202-2) must be a valid RUG Code for the Service From (2400 DTP03) and Service To (2400 DTP03) dates. If the Service dates are not present, the Code must be valid for the Statement From (2300 DTP03) and Statement To (2300 DTP03) dates. Reference the NUBC Manual For Valid Codes.

If Prod/Id Qual = HP and Revenue Code = 0023, Procedure Code must be a valid HRG Code for the Service From and Service To dates. If the Service dates are not present, the Code must be valid for the Statement From and Statement To dates. Reference the NUBC Manual For Valid Codes.

If Prod/Id Qual = HP and Revenue Code = 0024, Procedure Code must be a valid CMG/IRF Code for the Service From and Service To dates. If the Service dates are not present, the Code must be valid for the Statement From and Statement To dates. Reference the NUBC Manual For Valid Codes.
If Revenue Code is 0024, the Procedure Code is required.

Procedure codes of T0000-T9999 and H0000-H9999 are invalid values.

Procedure Code must be present when the following conditions are met:
- Bill Type (2300 CLM05-01) is NOT equal to: 110-115, 117-119, 120-129, 210-219, 180-189, 220-229, or 280-289
- Revenue Code is equal to: 0420-0429, or 0430-0439
- Statement From date is equal to or greater than 05/01/2005

Procedure Code must be present when the following conditions are met:
- Bill Type is NOT equal to: 110-129, 210-219, 180-189, 220-229, or 280-289
- Revenue Code is equal to: 0300-0329, 0333, 0340-0369, 0400-0409, 0490-0499, 0612, 0790-0799, 0570-0579 (only for BCBS and ITS), or 0750-0759 (only for FEP, HA, and USAble)
- an exception is made for HA and USA claims when Procedure code contains "INVCD", "invcd", or "Invcd" and the above conditions are met.

When present, the Procedure Code must be a valid HCPCS code for the Service Dates and/or Statement Dates.

All Lines of Business will allow H0031, H0032, H2012, H2019 and H2020 on or after 10/1/2011.

column36:
If present, Modifier 1 (2400 SV202) must be 2 characters in length.
If present, Modifier 1 must be a valid HCPCS Modifier.
When present, Modifier 1 must be a valid HCPCS Modifier (2400 SV202) for Service From (2400 DTP03) and Service To (2400 DTP03) dates and/or Statement From (2300 DTP03) and Statement To (2300 DTP03) dates.
Multiple occurrences of the same modifier is not allowed.

For FEP, ITS, HA, BCBS, BCBSX, BCBSAMI, TYSN, BAWM, USAL,USAA, USABLE, and AO, If the HCPCS Code (2400 SV202-2) is A0021-A0999, the Modifier must be one of the following:

For ITS, HA, BC, Exchange and BC AMISYS, if the HCPCS Code (2400 SV202-2) is A0021-A0999 and the revenue code is 0540-0549, RH Modifier is allowed.

column30: AO. ARCAID. BAWM. BCBS. BCBSAMI. BCBSSH. BCBSX. BCMDPK. COMM. FEP. HA. MCAR. MPA. TYSN. USAA. USABLE. USAL.
column36:
Medicare and Medipak Advantage:
If Revenue Code (2400 SV201) is "0022", "0024", "0180" or "0360" OR if Charge Amt (2400 SV203) is 0, then do not edit.
Charge Amt is Required, must be numeric, >= $0, <= $99,999,999.99, and Cannot Exceed 2 Decimal Places.

Medicaid and Commercial:
Charge Amt (2400 SV203) must be numeric.
Charge Amt cannot be missing.
If Revenue Code (2400 SV201) is "0022", "0024", "0180" or "0360"
OR if Charge Amt is 0, the above conditions do not apply.

Access Only:
Charge Amt must be numeric.
Charge Amt must be right justified.
Charge Amt must be greater than zero, except when Procedure Code (2400 SV202-02) is G8000-G8999, 90663, or G9141, OR on Inpatient Rehab Stays with Revenue Code 0024.
If Revenue Code is "0360" or "0490", the above conditions do not apply.

Medipak:
Charge Amt must be numeric.
Charge Amt must be right justified.
Charge Amt must be present. 
 
GCPS and Medipak:
Charge Amt must be numeric.
Charge Amt must be right justified.
Charge Amt must be greater than zero, except when Procedure Code is G8000-G8999, 90663, or G9142, OR on Inpatient Rehab Stays with Revenue Code 0024.
Charge Amt cannot be missing.
 
FEP:
Charge Amt must be numeric.
Charge Amt must be right justified.
Charge Amt must be greater than zero, except when Procedure Code is G8000-G8999, 90663, or G9142, OR on Inpatient Rehab Stays with Revenue Code 0024.
If Revenue Code is "0360", "0490" or "0750", Charge Amt cannot be negative.
 
Health Advantage, and USAble:
Charge Amt must be numeric.
Charge Amt must be right justified.
Charge Amt must be greater than zero, except when Procedure Code is G8000-G8999, 90663, or G9142, OR on Inpatient Rehab Stays with Revenue Code 0024.
Charge Amt cannot be missing.
If Revenue Code is "0360" or "0490", the above conditions do not apply.

the sum of the 2430 / CAS service line adjustments plus the 2430 / SVD02 service line paid amount must equal the 2400 / SV102 line item charge amount.  

Service line adjustment amounts can be sent in one or more of the following data elements in the 2430 / CAS (CAS03, CAS06, CAS09, CAS12, CAS15, CAS18).

Attachment Report Type Code (2400 PWK01) is required when the 2400 PWK segment is present. When  present, Attachment Report Type Code must be one of the following valid values: 03,04,05,06,07,08,09,10,11,13,15,21,A3,A4,AM,AS,B2,B3,B4,BR,BS,BT,CB,CK,CT,D2,DA,DB,DG,DJ,DS,EB,HC,HR,I5,IR,LA,M1,MT,NN,OB,OC,OD,OE,OX,OZ,P4,P5,PE,PN,PO,PQ,PY,PZ,RB,RR,RT,RX,SG,V5, or XP.

When present, Attachment Transmission Code must be one of the following valid values: AA, BM, EL, EM, FT or FX.

If Attachment Control Number (2400 PWK06) is present, Attachment Transmission Code (2400 PWK02) must be BM, EM, FX, or FT. Attachment Control Number must be at least 2 characters, cannot exceed 50 characters and must contain valid characters. Valid characters are: 0-9, a-z, A-Z, -, space, comma, period, ), (, /, #, !, @, $, %, ^, &, +, =, _, \, |, ;, <, ?, {, }, [, ], and '.

When present, Attachment Control Number must be between 2 and 50 characters in length and must contain valid characters. Valid characters are: 0-9, a-z, A-Z, -, space, comma, period, ), (, /, #, !, @, $, %, ^, &, +, =, _, \, |, ;, <, ?, {, }, [, ], and '.

column30: AO. BAWM. BCBS. BCMDPK. FEP. HA. ITS. MPA. USAA. USABLE. USAL. TYSN. BCBSX. BCBSAMI. BCBSSH.
column36:
When present, the Service From (2400 DTP03) date must be:
- a valid date (all private LOBs)

- right-justified (only GCPS, HA and USA)

- greater than or equal to Statement From (2300 DTP03) date (all LOBs)
(for ITS and MPA claims with Revenue Code (2300 SV201) 0022-0023, this edit is ignored)

- less than or equal to Statement To (2300 DTP03) date (all LOBs)
(for ITS and MPA claims with Revenue Code 0022-0023, this edit is ignored)

- less than or equal to current system date (all LOBs except GCPS)
(for HA or USA Dakota claims, if the Bill Type (2300 CLM05-1) is 110-119,120-129,180-189,210-219,220-229,280-289, this edit is ignored. For ITS claims with Bill Type of 322 or 332, the Service From date can be a future date)

-For ITS, allow the DATE OF SERVICE to be up to 3 calendar days prior to the ‘Statement From, when the Revenue Code is one of the following: 
0254, 0255, 030X, 031X, 032X. 0341, 035X, 0371, 0372, 040X, 046X, 0471, 048X, 053X, 061X, 062X, 073X, 074X, 092X

Date Of Service must be on or after the Effective Date of the Plan.

If the service date from field is not a valid date, "Service From Date Invalid" will display.
If the service date from field is greater than current date, "Service From Date Must be Less Than or Equal to Current Date" will display.

If the billtype begins with 13,14,23,24,32,33,34,71,72,73,74,75,76,81,82,83 or 85, and the revenue code is not 0001, the service date from field must be present or "Service Date Required For This Billtype" will display.

09/05/2006-DMC-Converted from old script.
03/19/2008-DMC-Added ARCAID and COMM per 2008078002.

When present, the Service To Date must be:
- a valid date
- less than or equal to the current date

12/12/2006-CLM-PR2006334020 - Conversion of old engine edit.
03/20/2008-DMC-Added ARCAID and COMM per ProTrac 2008078004.

If the service to date is not a valid date, "Service To Date Invalid" will display.
If the service to date is greater than current date, "Service To Date Must be Less Than or Equal to Current Date" will display.
If the service from date is greater than the service to date, "Statement To Date Must Be >= Statement From Date" will display.

If the billtype begins with 12,13,14,22,23,24,32,33,34,71,72,73,74,75,76,81,82,83 or 85, and the revenue code is not 0001, the service date from field must be present or "Must Be Single Date For This Type Of Bill - Range Not Allowed" will display.


09/05/2006-DMC-Converted from old script.

If Procedure Code (2400 HCP10) is present, Prod/Id Qual (2400 HCP09) is required.

If Prod/Id Qual (2400 HCP09) = HP, Procedure Code (2400 HCP10) must be a valid HIPPS (RUG or HRG) code. Reference the NUBC Manual For Valid Codes.

If Prod/Id Qual (2400 HCP09) = HC, Procedure Code (2400 HCP10) must be a valid HCPCS code for the Service From (2400 DTP03) and Service To (2400 DTP03) dates. Reference the NUBC Manual For Valid Codes.

If Drug Identification Qual is present, it must be one of the following valid values: VY, XZ.

Prescription Number (2410 REF02) is required if Drug Identification Qual (2410 REF01) is present. Prescription Number cannot exceed 50 characters, and must contain valid characters. If 2430 SVD03-1 Equals ZZ, Validate PROCEDURE/RUG Codes. Reference the NUBC Manual For Valid Codes.

08/01/2008-RMP-2008204012 - Updated to use RUG table for verification instead of hard-coded list of values.

If the 2430 SVD segment is present, Procedure Code (2430 SVD03-02) is required.
If Prod/Id Qual (2430 SVD03-01) = HP and Revenue Code (2430 SVD04) = 0022, Procedure Code (2430 SVD03-02) must be a valid RUG code for the Service From (2400 DTP03) and Service To (2400 DTP03) dates. If the Service dates are not present, the Code must be valid for the Statement From (2300 DTP03) and Statement To (2300 DTP03) dates.  Reference the NUBC Manual For Valid Codes.

If Prod/Id Qual (2430 SVD03-01) = HP and Revenue Code (2430 SVD04) = 0023, Procedure Code (2430 SVD03-02) must be a valid HRG code for the Service From (2400 DTP03) and Service To (2400 DTP03) dates. If the Service dates are not present, the Code must be valid for the Statement From (2300 DTP03) and Statement To (2300 DTP03) dates.  Reference the NUBC Manual For Valid Codes.

Procedure Code must be a valid HCPCS code for the Service Dates and/or Statement Dates.

If present, Modifier 1 (2430 SVD03-03) must be 2 characters in length.
If present, Modifier 1 must be a valid HCPCS Modifier.
When present, Modifier 1 must be a valid HCPCS Modifier (2430 SVD03-03) for Service From (2400 DTP03) and Service To (2400 DTP03) dates and/or Statement From (2300 DTP03) and Statement To (2300 DTP03) dates.
If the HCPCS Code (2430 SV302-2) is A0021-A0999, the Modifier will not be validated.
Do not allow multiple occurrences of the same procedure modifier

column30: AO. BAWM. BCBS. BCBSAMI. BCBSSH. BCBSX. FEP. HA. ITS. TYSN. USAA. USABLE. USAL.
column36:
Claims with DOS on or after 4/1/2013 submitted from providers with Medicare primary and cob information populated must use CARC code 223 if date submitted to AHIN is 1/5/2014 and earlier and must use CARC code 253 if date submitted to AHIN is 1/6/2014 and later.

The ASC X12 Committee has approved Claim Adjustment Reason Code (CARC) 253, defined as "Sequestration-reduction in federal payments," to be effective June 2, 2013.
Implementation of CARC 253 will not occur, however, until January 6, 2014.
Therefore, CARC 253 will replace CARC 223 (defined as "Adjustment code for mandated Federal, State or Local law/regulation that is not already covered by another by another code and is mandated before a new code can be created") on all outbound COBA crossover claims that Medicare creates and then sends to our COB Contractor (COBC) beginning January 6, 2014.

2014080027 - rmt - 03/24/2014 - first implementation
2015085016 - rmt - 03/26/2015 - use dos and date of submission

 is Required when the 2430 CAS Segment is Present.
 Must be Numeric
 Must be >= -99,999,999.99 and <= 99,999,999.99
 Must Not Equal 0
 Limited to 0, 1, or 2 Decimal Places

column36:
Claims with DOS on or after 4/1/2013 submitted from providers with Medicare primary and cob information populated must use CARC code 223 if date submitted to AHIN is 1/5/2014 and earlier and must use CARC code 253 if date submitted to AHIN is 1/6/2014 and later.

The ASC X12 Committee has approved Claim Adjustment Reason Code (CARC) 253, defined as "Sequestration-reduction in federal payments," to be effective June 2, 2013.
Implementation of CARC 253 will not occur, however, until January 6, 2014.
Therefore, CARC 253 will replace CARC 223 (defined as "Adjustment code for mandated Federal, State or Local law/regulation that is not already covered by another by another code and is mandated before a new code can be created") on all outbound COBA crossover claims that Medicare creates and then sends to our COB Contractor (COBC) beginning January 6, 2014.

2014080027 - rmt - 03/24/2014 - first implementation
2015085016 - rmt - 03/26/2015 - use dos and date of submission

When the second iteration of either Submitter Contact Qualifier 1 (1000A PER03) or Submitter Contact Number 1 (1000A PER04) is present, both are required. Submitter Contact Qualifier 1 must be TE, EM, EX or FX. When Submitter Contact Qualifier 1 is TE, EX or FX, Submitter Contact Number 1 must be numeric. When Submitter Contact Qualifier 1 is TE or FX, Submitter Contact Number 1 must be length of 10. When Submitter Contact Qualifier 1 is EM, Submitter Contact Number 1 must be valid characters and not exceed 256 characters.

2011115007 - 05/12/2011 - clm - new edit to replace a portion of edit 1958
2011115007 - 05/12/2011 - clm - added commercial
2011118005 - 05/12/2011 - clm - added medicaid

When the second iteration of either Submitter Contact Qualifier 2 (1000A PER05) or Submitter Contact Number 2 (1000A PER06) is present, both are required. Submitter Contact Qualifier 2 must be TE, EM, EX or FX. Submitter Contact Qualifier 2 cannot equal EX unless Submitter Contact Qualifier 1 (2010AA PER03) is TE. When Submitter Contact Qualifier 2 is TE, EX or FX, Submitter Contact Number 2 must be numeric. When Submitter Contact Qualifier 2 is TE or FX, Submitter Contact Number 2 must be length of 10. When Submitter Contact Qualifier 2 is EM, Submitter Contact Number 2 must be valid characters and not exceed 256 characters.

When the second iteration of either Submitter Contact Qualifier 3 (1000A PER07) or Submitter Contact Number 3 (1000A PER08) is present, both are required. Submitter Contact Qualifier 3 must be TE, EM, EX or FX. Submitter Contact Qualifier 3 cannot equal EX unless Submitter Contact Qualifier 2 (2010AA PER05) is TE. When Submitter Contact Qualifier 3 is TE, EX or FX, Submitter Contact Number 3 must be numeric. When Submitter Contact Qualifier 3 is TE or FX, Submitter Contact Number 3 must be length of 10. When Submitter Contact Qualifier 3 is EM, Submitter Contact Number 3 must be valid characters and not exceed 256 characters.

column36:
If the Payer Org ID cannot be identified, set Subscriber ID (2010BA NM109) in error and reject the claim.
Do not allow DataCap (OCR) claims with an encoder number that is already in AHIN.
Claim cannot be more than 50 detail lines long and cannot contain zero detail lines.
Instate Medicaid Secondary Payer claims that have Dates of Service more than 3 years old will be rejected. 
Out-of-state Medicaid Secondary Payer claims for FEP, Tyson and Wal-Mart that have Dates of Service more than 3 years old will be rejected. Submitter id E6355 bypasses timely filing.
Out-of-state Medicaid Secondary Payer claims for Health Advantage and BlueCross that have Dates of Service before 1-1-2007 will be rejected. 

NOTE: This edit must run first to set up the validation environment for other edits as follows:
instantiate global variables: editproc_init, maxdetno
instantiate/include editprocs.tcl to edit procedure library.
set global variables: DUMMYUPIN, VALID_NAME_CHARS, VALID_NAME_CHARS_SHT, BIG_CHARS_LIST, EMAIL_CHARS_LIST, flag2320AMT01D, and LOB_FLAG.

Doctor on Demand (submitter E3397) can only submit claims for WalMart, Tyson and Navistar members. Navistar claims must include prefix "ITS". Doctor on Demand cannot submit claims with dates of service before 01/01/2016.

column36:
check eligibility flags, set appropriate error and stop editing claim:
  If No Service From Dates on Claim, then Error and Stop Editing
  If Invalid Alpha-Prefix , then Error and Stop Editing
  If Access Only Policy and Coverage Not In Effect then Error and Stop Editing
  If Policy Submitted Was Found, but Patient Not On It, then Error and Stop Editing
  If Policy Not Found, then Error and Stop Editing
  If Last Name, First Name, or DOB Doesn't Match the Policy, Error Appropriate Fields and Stop Editing
  If Policy Found And Name/Dob Match But Coverage Is Not In Effect, then Error and Stop Editing

column36:
If claim is Medicaid Secondary Payer Claim then the Billing Provider NPI Qual (2010AA NM108) and Billing Provider NPI (2010AA NM109) are required.  No other editing performed on these fields, except for FEP. 

For MPA only, verify the tax id/NPI combination on claim is correct according to the provider record on ProvWeb.

Billing Provider ID Qualifier (2010AA NM108) Must Be XX.
NPI (2010AA NM109) must be valid and 10 digits.
NPI (2010AA NM109) Cannot be OutOfState/NonPar.
NPI (2010AA NM109) Must Be Registered With ABCBS.
NPI (2010AA NM109) must not be Termed.

Ancillary providers are Independent Clinical Laboratory, Durable/Home Medical Equipment and Supplies and Specialty Pharmacy providers. The local Blue Plan as defined for ancillary services is as follows:
 
Independent Clinical Laboratory (Lab) 
­	The Plan in whose state the specimen was drawn.

Durable/Home Medical Equipment and Supplies (DME, Mail Order, Insulin Pump Supply, Orthotics/Prosthetics)
­	The Plan in whose state the equipment was shipped to or purchased at a retail store.

Specialty Pharmacy
­	The Plan in whose state the Ordering Physician is located.

Specialty Pharmacy
­	The Plan in whose state the Ordering Physician is located.

column19:
#validateNM10809 { qualifier nm109field ooscheck valogic loopid required }
set "" [validateNM10809_5 $thisvalue "BILLINGPROVIDER" "N" "Y" "2010aa" "Y"]
# qualifier  = the nm108 qualifier for the current field.
# nm109field = the fieldname containing the nm109 value
# ooscheck   = if Y then we will perform the NPI Lookup and out of state check for NPI on Provweb info.
# ooscheck     if D then we will perform the NPI Lookup and Date check, but not the out of state indicator check.
# valogic    = if Y then we will perform the valogic
# loopid     = name of loop we are editing, if 2010aa/2010ab, then additional stuff will be done below.
# required   = if Y then we will require both nm108 & nm109 be present if they are both blank.

column36:
If Subscriber 2nd ID Qualifier is missing when Subscriber 2nd ID is present, the error message "Subscriber 2nd ID Qualifier Required When Subscriber 2nd ID Present" is displayed. When Subscriber 2nd ID Qualifier is present, it must be equal to SY or error message "Subscriber 2nd ID Qualifier Must = SY" is displayed.

10/25/2007-CLM-P2007298011 - Added Commercial and Medicaid to edit.

The Subscriber 2nd ID Qualifier (2010BA REF01) is required when Subscriber 2nd ID (2010BA REF02) is present. When Subscriber 2nd ID Qualifier is present, it must not be equal to "SY".

column36:
If claim is Medicaid Secondary Payer Claim then the Billing Provider NPI Qual (2010AA NM108) and Billing Provider NPI (2010AA NM109) are required.  No other editing performed on these fields, except for FEP. 

For MPA only, verify the tax id/NPI combination on claim is correct according to the provider record on ProvWeb.

For all other claims:
Billing Provider NPI (2010AA NM109) and Qualifier (2010AA NM108) are Required
Billing Provider Qualifier Must Be XX.
Billing Provider NPI must be valid and 10 digits.
Billing Provider NPI Cannot be OutOfState/NonPar.
Billing Provider NPI Must Be Registered With ABCBS.
Billing Provider NPI must not be Termed.

2008198013 - added code to "return" out if flag ISMCD2=Y, for Medicaid secondary payer claims
2009058017 - removed FEP
2009259004 - add FEP
2009355003-RMP-changed order to 20, Pass all facility claims with Billtype of 110 after verifying eligibility, Billing/Payto NPI, and statement to/from dates.
2010246026 - 9/22/10 - slc - updated documentation.
2011073014-03/31/2011-rmp-added bawm
2012338044 - 12/04/2012 - slc - adjust tyson edits to match bawm
2013085005 - 03/26/2013 - rmt - FEP MCD2 should follow regular FEP
2013123008 - 05/03/2013 - slc - added Exchange Payers to edit for baseline
2013140007 - 05/22/2013 - slc - added Exchange Shop Payer to edit for baseline
2016054009 - 02/24/2016 - rmt- for MPA only, verify taxid/npi association

If claim is MCD2 (flag in cache) = 'Y', then the Billing Provider NPI Qual (2010AA NM108) and Billing Provider NPI (2010AA NM109) are required.

If Submitter ID = 'x0020' (Dakota paper claims) or begins with U, the Billing Provider NPI Qual (2010AA NM108) must be XX and the Billing Provider NPI (2010AA NM109) must be valid, and NPI can be termed.

For all other claims:
Billing Provider ID Qualifier (2010AA NM108) Must Be XX.
Billing Provider NPI (2010AA NM109) must be valid and 10 digits.
Billing Provider NPI must not be Termed.

2008198013 - added code to "return" out if flag ISMCD2=Y, for Medicaid secondary payer claims
2009355003-RMP-changed order to 20, Pass all facility claims with Billtype of 110 after verifying eligibility, Billing/Payto NPI, and statement to/from dates.
2010246026 - 9/21/10 - fmb - updated documentation.
2011073014-03/31/2011-rmp-removed bawm
2012292012 - 10/22/2012 - slc - added Tyson to edit for baseline
2012338044 - 12/04/2012 - slc - adjust tyson edits to match bawm
2014183008 - 09/18/2014 - rmt - added U submitter logic

# loopid     = name of loop we are editing, if 2010aa/2010ab, then additional stuff will be done below.
# required   = if Y then we will require both nm108 & nm109 be present if they are both blank.

When present, the Line Notes (2400 NTE02) cannot exceed 80 chars in length and must be AlphaNumeric. Valid characters are: 0-9, a-z, A-Z, -, space, comma, period, ), (, /, #, !, @, $, %, ^, &, +, =, _, \, |, ;, <, ?, {, }, [, ], and '.

2010316003 - 11/17/2010 - slc - 5010:Medicare & MPA Edit Updates
2011115007 - 06/01/2011 - clm - added commercial
2011118005 - 06/01/2011 - clm - added medicaid

Ambulance Drop Off Location Address, City, State and Zip Code (2310F N3 and 2310F N4) are required when Ambulance Drop Off Location Name (2310F NM103) is present. Ambulance Drop Off Location Name cannot be more than 60 characters. Valid characters are: 0-9, a-z, A-Z, -, space, comma, period, ), (, /, #, !, @, $, %, ^, &, +, =, _, \, |, ;, <, ?, {, }, [, ], and '.

2010316003-12/06/2010-rmp-created edit for Medicare and added Medipak Advantage.
2011115007 - 05/06/2011 - slc - added ARCAID & COMM
2013200011 - 07/24/2013 - slc - added Medicare Part B Railroad Payer to edit for baseline

If the Ambulance Drop Off Location Name (2420H NM109) is present, it must contain valid characters, and cannot exceed 60 characters. Valid characters are: 0-9, a-z, A-Z, -, space, comma, period, ), (, /, #, !, @, $, %, ^, &, +, =, _, \, |, ;, <, ?, {, }, [, ], and '.
Ambulance Drop Off Location Name is required when the 2420H Loop is present.

2010326002-12/1/2010-rmp-new MCARE/MPA requirements

If POA is present, the diagnosis must also be present.

column30: AO. BAWM. BCBS. BCBSAMI. BCBSSH. BCBSX. FEP. HA. ITS. TYSN. USAA. USABLE.
column36:
Institutional Inpatient (Billtype= 111-118) claims from non-exempt providers must have a POA indicator (2300 HI01-9) for each Diagnosis Code (2300 HI01-02 through HI12-02) on the claim.
The valid POA indicators are: N,U,W,Y. Paper claims allow N,U,W,Y and 1.

POA is not required for exempt diagnosis codes.
If POA is present, the diagnosis must also be present.

If claim has service dates both prior to and on or after compliance date, claims must be split such that services prior to compliance date are billed on one claim with ICD-9 codes and services on or after compliance date are billed on second claim with ICD-10 codes.

If Patient Relationship Code is SELF (18) the Subscriber Last Name (2010BA NM103), Subscriber First Name (2010BA NM104) and Subscriber Date of Birth (2010BA DMG02) information listed below MUST MATCH the Patient information (2010CA) when the Patient Information is Provided.

If Access Only, the Source of Pay code (2000B SBR09) must be BL.

if {[isMCD2]==1} {
   if {![IsPresent]} { setError "Cannot be Blank" }
   if {![IsPresent [getField BILLINGPROVIDER]]} { setError "Cannot be Blank" BILLINGPROVIDER}
   return
}

# ooscheck   = if Y then we will perform the NPI Lookup and out of state check for NPI on Provweb info.

column36:
If the Billing Provider ID Qualifier (2010AA NM108) is present, the Billing Provider ID (2010AA NM109) must be present or the claim will reject.

If the Billing Provider ID (2010AA NM109) is present, the Billing Provider ID Qualifier (2010AA NM108) must be present or the claim will reject.

If the Billing Provider ID Qualifier (2010AA NM108) must contain ‘XX’ or the claim will reject.
If the Billing Provider ID (2010AA NM109) is not valid or is not 10 digits, the claim will reject.


NOTE: the NPI cannot be out of state/AnonPar, it must be registered with ABCBS and must not be termed or the claim will reject.

column19:
# need to iterateAll since the ref02 might be crossmapped to bao:* values
# causing edit to end before the appropriate field is reached.
set iterateALL 1
set refqual "BILLING_SECOND_ID_TYPE:$thisfldno"
set error_msg "Provider ID"
set subID [getField SUBEIN]
if {$subID=="X0020" && $vScript!="MPA."} {
  return
}
set "" [verifyRelation $refqual $error_msg]
column36:
If the Billing Second ID (2010AA REF02) is present, the Billing Second ID Qualifier (2010AA REF01) must be present or the claim will reject.
If the Billing Second ID Qualifier (2010AA REF01) is present, the Billing Second ID  (2010AA REF02) must be present or the claim will reject.

2010099011 - added for dental
2010218002-07/21/2011- DMC - Revised per 5010 IG.

column13: Subscriber Birth Date: In the format MM/DD/YYYY
column36:
If this claim is a Medicaid Secondary Payer claim, these edits do not apply.

When Patient Relationship field (2000B SBR02) is 18 (SELF), the Subscriber Birth Date field (2010BA DMG02) must be present or the claim will reject. 
When the Subscriber Birth Date field (2010BA DMG02) is present, it must contain a valid date, and it cannot be greater than the AHIN system date or the claim will reject.

If Patient Relationship field (2000B SBR02) is 18 (Self), then the Subscriber Gender Code (2010BA DMG03) field must be present or the claim will reject.
If present, the Subscriber Gender Code (2010BA DMG03) field must contain M, F, or U or the claim will reject.

Subscriber Last Name Field (2010BA NM103) must be present or the claim will reject.
Subscriber Last Name Field (2010BA NM103) Must Be Left Justified or the claim will reject.
Subscriber Last Name Field (2010BA NM103) cannot Be UNKNOWN or the claim will reject.
Subscriber Last Name Field (2010BA NM103) First Character Must Be A-Z or the claim will reject.

LOB Specific:
If the claim is Access Only, FEP, ITS, or Blue Advantage, the Subscriber Last Name Field (2010BA NM103) must Contain Valid Characters "A-Z,'-',' ','.'" or the claim will reject.

If the claim is Health Advantage or Blue Cross, the Subscriber Last Name Field (2010BA NM103)
Must Contain Valid Characters "A-Z,'-',' ','.','(',')'" or the claim will reject.

2010218002-07/11/2011-DMC-revised for 5010 Dental

2012292012 - 10/22/2012 - slc - added Tyson to edit for baseline
2013123008 - 05/03/2013 - slc - added Exchange Payers to edit for baseline
2013140007 - 05/22/2013 - slc - added Exchange Shop Payer to edit for baseline

The Subscriber First Name (2010BA NM104) must be left justified, cannot contain invalid characters, cannot be ‘unknown’ and the first character must contain A-Z or the claim will reject.
Valid characters for the Subscriber First Name (2010BA NM104) field for Access Only, FEP, ITS, Blue Advantage are:  ‘A-Z, '-' , ' ' , '.'.
Valid characters for the Subscriber First Name (2010BA NM104) field for Health Advantage, Blue Cross are: ‘A-Z, '-' , ' ' , '.' , '(',')'

2010218002-06/15/2011-DMC-revised for 5010 Dental

If the Subscriber ID Number field (2010BA NM109) is not present, the claim will reject.
The Subscriber ID Number field (2010BA NM109) Must Be Left Justified or the claim will reject.
The Subscriber ID Number field (2010BA NM109) Must Have Length of 9 or the claim will reject.
The Subscriber ID Number field (2010BA NM109) First Character Must Be R or the claim will reject.
The Subscriber ID Number field (2010BA NM109) cannot have embedded spaces or the claim will reject.
The Subscriber ID Number field (2010BA NM109) Positions 2-9 Must Be Numeric or the claim will reject.
Contracts for FEP that start with "R9" are considered test contracts and are invalid.

If the Payer ID Qualifier (2010BB NM108) is missing, the claim will reject.
If the Payer ID Qualifier (2010BB NM108) is present and the Payer ID Number (2010BB NM109) is not present, the claim will reject.

If the Payer ID Qualifier (2010BB NM108) does not equal "PI" or "XV", the claim will reject.

Do not allow ICD9 and ICD10 codes on same claim.
For claims with dates of service before 10/1/2015, Diagnosis Type (2300 HI01-01) must be BK.
For claims with dates of service on or after 10/1/2015, Diagnosis Type (2300 HI01-01) must be ABK.

Diag Code 1 must be a valid ICD9/ICD10 code and left-justified.
If Diag Code 1 is 3 or 4 digits and a 4 or 5 digit code is available, then it must be coded to the most specific level.
Multiple occurrences of the same diagnosis code is not allowed.

For claims with dates of service before 10/1/2015, Diagnosis Type (2300 HI02-01) must be BF.
For claims with dates of service on or after 10/1/2015, Diagnosis Type (2300 HI02-01) must be ABF.

If Diag Code 2 (2300 HI01-02) is Blank, then no validation is performed. 

Diag Code 1 cannot be blank if Diag Code 2 contains a value.

Diag Code 2 must be a valid ICD9/ICD10 code and left-justified.

If Diag Code 2 is 3 or 4 digits and a 4 or 5 digit code is available, then it must be coded to the most specific level.

Multiple occurrences of the same diagnosis code is not allowd.

For claims with dates of service before 10/1/2015, Diagnosis Type (2300 HI03-01) must be BF.
For claims with dates of service on or after 10/1/2015, Diagnosis Type (2300 HI03-01) must be ABF.

If Diag Code 3 (2300 HI01-02) is Blank, then no validation is performed. 

Diag Code 1 and 2 cannot be blank if Diag Code 3 contains a value.

Diag Code 3 must be a valid ICD9/ICD10 code and left-justified.

If Diag Code 3 is 3 or 4 digits and a 4 or 5 digit code is available, then it must be coded to the most specific level.

Multiple occurrences of the same diagnosis code is not allowed.

For claims with dates of service before 10/1/2015, Diagnosis Type (2300 HI04-01) must be BF.
For claims with dates of service on or after 10/1/2015, Diagnosis Type (2300 HI04-01) must be ABF.

If Diag Code 4 (2300 HI01-02) is Blank, then no validation is performed. 

Diag Code 1, 2 and 3 cannot be blank if Diag Code 4 contains a value.

Diag Code 4 must be a valid ICD9/ICD10 code and left-justified.

If Diag Code 4 is 3 or 4 digits and a 4 or 5 digit code is available, then it must be coded to the most specific level.

Multiple occurrences of the same diagnosis code is not allowed.

If present, the Referring Provider Secondary ID Qualifier (2310A REF01) must be 0B, 1G, or G2 or the claim will reject.

If the HCPCS Procedure code (2400 SV301 2) is not present, the claim will reject.
If the HCPCS Procedure code (2400 SV301 2) value length is not 5 digits, the claim will reject.
If this is an FEP claim, and the HCPCS Procedure code (2400 SV301 2) contains values D0110-D9999,K0000-K9999, no further edits are validated.
If this is an MediPak Advantage claim, and the HCPCS Procedure code (2400 SV301 2) contains values K0000-K9999,C0000-C9999, no further edits are validated.
If this is a Health Advantage, USABLE, USAA, USAL, BAWM, or MediPak Advantage claim, and the HCPCS Procedure code (2400 SV301 2) contains values INVCD, invcd, or Invcd, no further edits are validated.
If this is a Health Advantage, BCBSREG, MEDIPAK, or MediPak Advantage claim, and the HCPCS Procedure code (2400 SV301 2) contains 90701, error message "90701 Isn't Commercially Available, Use 90700 DTAP-Acellular Pertussis" will display.
If this is an ITS claim, and the HCPCS Procedure code (2400 SV301 2) contains values K0000-K9999, error message "Invalid Code For This Payer - Refile With Appropriate CPT/HCPCS Code" will display.
If this is an ITS claim, and the HCPCS Procedure code (2400 SV301 2) contains values K0000-K9999, C0000-C9999, T0000-T9999, H0000-H9999, error message "Invalid Code For This Payer - Refile With Appropriate CPT/HCPCS Code" will display.
If the HCPCS Procedure code (2400 SV301 2) contains an invalid HCPCS code, the claim will reject.
If the HCPCS Procedure code (2400 SV301 2) contains an HCPCS code that is not valid for the date of service (2300 DPT03), the claim will reject.
If the HCPCS Procedure code (2400 SV301 2) is not left justified, the claim will reject.
If the HCPCS Procedure code (2400 SV301 2) contains any of the following: 90780, 90781, 90782, 90784, 96400, 96408, 96410, 96412, or 96414, the error message "Invalid CPT CD for PYR File.  File with Approp CD from Range G0345-G0363” will display and the claim will reject.

HCPCS Modifier 2 Cannot Be Present If HCPCS Modifier 1 Is Blank.

2011144011 - RMP - 05/24/2011 - require modifiers to be consecutive

HCPCS Modifier 3 Cannot Be Present If HCPCS Modifier 2 Is Blank.

2011144011 - RMP - 05/24/2011 - require modifiers to be consecutive

HCPCS Modifier 4 Cannot Be Present If HCPCS Modifier 3 Is Blank.

2011144011 - RMP - 05/24/2011 - require modifiers to be consecutive

The Line Charge (2400 SV302) must be present, numeric and greater than $0.00. Only when the HCPCS Code is G8000-G8999, 90663, or G9142, $0.00 is allowed.

If Code (2400 SV101-02) is "A0021-A0999", then Diag Cd Ptr (2400 SV107-01) is not required.
Diag Cd Ptr 1 must be numeric.
Decimals are not allowed in Diag Cd Ptr 1.
Diag Cd Ptr 1 must be 1 thru 4.  
Diag Cd Ptr 1 must reference a Diag Code (2300 HI02-02) that is present, left-justified, valid for the date of service, and coded to the most specific level.

If Diag Cd Ptr 2 is populated, Diag Cd Ptr 1 must be populated.
Diag Cd Ptr 2 must be numeric.
Decimals are not allowed in Diag Cd Ptr 2.
Diag Cd Ptr 2 must be 1 thru 4.  
Diag Cd Ptr 2 must reference a Diag Code (2300 HI02-02) that is present, left-justified, valid for the date of service, and coded to the most specific level.

If Diag Cd Ptr 3 is populated, Diag Cd Ptr 1 and 2 must be populated.
Diag Cd Ptr 3 must be numeric.
Decimals are not allowed in Diag Cd Ptr 3.
Diag Cd Ptr 3 must be 1 thru 4.  
Diag Cd Ptr 3 must reference a Diag Code (2300 HI02-02) that is present, left-justified, valid for the date of service, and coded to the most specific level.

If Diag Cd Ptr 4 is populated, Diag Cd Ptr 1 through 3 must be populated.
Diag Cd Ptr 4 must be numeric.
Decimals are not allowed in Diag Cd Ptr 4.
Diag Cd Ptr 4 must be 1 thru 4.  
Diag Cd Ptr 4 must reference a Diag Code (2300 HI02-02) that is present, left-justified, valid for the date of service, and coded to the most specific level.

If Tooth Surface Code (2400 TOO03) is present, it must be one of the following values: B,D,F,I,L,M,or O.

If a BAA claim (PYR_ORG_ID='011B63','000002','0119C7','0119C8') and it is a Paper Claim (Submitter Number = 'x0020' 1000A NM109) DO NOT EDIT

If claim contains high tech radiology procedure codes (70336,70450-70555,71250-71555,72125-72159,72191-72198,73200-73225,73700-73725,74150-74185,74261-74263,75557-75574,75635,76093,76094,76380,76390,76400,77058,77059,77084,78451,78459,78465-78469,78481-78492,78499,78608,78609,7811-78816,0042T,G0235,S8037,S8042) OR is of a specialty type Radiation Therapy (payspec='031') or Sleep Study (payspec='0SS') OR if the Facility Type POS (2300 CLM05-01) is Independant Lab ('81) DO NOT EDIT

If Pay to Specialty is an Imaging center ('0IC') AND the claim contains lines with radiology procedure codes (0000T-0200T,70000-79999,93000-93400,93600-93619,93701-93770,93875-93899,93922-93990,A9500-A9999,G0100-G0400,J0152,J0280,J1245,J1250,J2785,Q0000-Q9999,S8000-S8999) AND the Pay to type is a Clinic AND the Facility Type POS (2300 CLM05-01) is an office ('11') or an Independent clinic ('49') DO NOT EDIT

If Pay to type is 'D' (determined by SP) then there is a Home Infusion or DME specialty involved DO NOT EDIT

If Pay to type is 'B' it means that this NPI has both a listing as a clinic and a individual. If the Rendering information is present at either the claim (2310B NM109) or the line level (2420A NM109) then the Pay to NPI is treated as a Clinic and follows the regular flow detailed below, else the NPI is treated as an individual and follows flow below

REGULAR FLOW:
Pay to type is 'C' for Clinic, Rendering NPI(2420A NM109) is present, the invalid flag (returned by SP) is 'Y', then the provider affiliation does not exist. Regardless, if the Rendering type is a Clinic, Facility or Group it is invalid
ELSE if the pay to type is a 'C' and no Rendering info exists at either the claim (2310B NM109) or the line level (2420A NM109) then the claim is in error, ELSE if the claim level rendering info exists and the invalid flag is 'Y' the affiliation is in conflict.

Pay to type is 'P' for Individual, and Rendering NPI(2420A NM109) is present, the Rendering has to be equal to the Billing NPI(2010AA NM109) or the rendering type has to be "I" for Individual if the invalid flag (from SP) equals 'Y' the affiliation does not exist.
ELSE the claim level Rendering NPI(2420A NM109) must equal the Billing NPI(2010AA NM109) or be type "I". If the invalid flag (from SP) equals 'Y' the affiliation does not exist.

if { [IsPresentZero] != 1 && [IsPresent $RsnCde] == 1 } {
   setError "Adjustment Amount 6 Required When Adjustment Reason Code 6 Is Present"
}
column36:
When Adjustment Reason Code 6 (2430 CAS17) is present, Adjustment Amount 6 (2430 CAS18) is required.

column30: AO. ARCAID. BAWM. BCBS. BCBSAMI. BCBSSH. BCBSX. BCMDPK. COMM. DEFAULT. FEP. HA. ITS. MCAR. MCBRR. MCOCR. MPA. MXOV. SIM. TYSN. USAA. USABLE. USAL.
column36:
if pyr_org_id is blank, the claim will reject.
If this claim is other than FEP, the claim will reject. Only FEP is accepting electronic dental claims at this time.
If there are more than 50 detail lines in the claim, the claim will reject.
If there are no detail lines, the claim will reject.

checks eligibility flags, sets appropriate error and stops editing claim:
  If No Service From Dates (2400 DTP03) on Claim, the claim will stop editing and reject.
  If the PYR_ORG_ID field contains an invalid Alpha-Prefix , the claim will stop editing and reject.
  If the Access Only Policy and Coverage Not In Effect, the claim will stop editing and reject.
  If the Policy submitted was found, but the patient is not on it, the claim will stop editing and reject.
  If the policy is not found, the claim will stop editing and reject.
  If Last Name, First Name, or DOB Doesn't Match the Policy, the claim will stop editing and reject.
  If Policy Found And Name/Dob Match But Coverage Is Not In Effect, the claim will stop editing and reject.

column19:
if {[isMCD2]==1} {return}
#validateNM10809 qualifier nm109field ooscheck valogic loopid required
set "" [validateNM10809_5D $thisvalue "REFPROV" "N" "N" "2310a" "N"]
# qualifier  = the nm108 qualifier for the current field.
# nm109field = the fieldname containing the nm109 value
# ooscheck   = if Y then we will perform the NPI Lookup and out of state check for NPI on Provweb info.
# ooscheck     if D then we will perform the NPI Lookup and Date check, but not the out of state indicator check.
# valogic    = if Y then we will perform the valogic
# loopid     = name of loop we are editing, if 2010aa/2010ab, then additional stuff will be done below.
# required   = if Y then we will require both nm108 & nm109 be present if they are both blank.
column36:

If present, NPI (2310A NM109) must be valid and 10 digits.

column30: AO. BAWM. BCBS. BCMDPK. DEFAULT. FEP. HA. ITS. MPA. USAA. USABLE. USAL. TYSN. BCBSX. BCBSAMI. BCBSSH.
column36:
'invalid_2000b_sbr01'; (IS) must be S or T. anything else is unexpected
'missing_icn'; (IS) no icn in claim
'icn_not_found'; (IS/AHIN) why can we not find previous claim
'icn_not_unique'; (IS/AHIN) why is this icn not unique.
'no_boblist.1'; (IS/AHIN) always expect this as bare min required, if not, why are we here
'no_boblist.2'; (IS/AHIN) always expect this as bare min required, if not, why are we here
'invalid_boblist'; (AHIN) we didnt match 2000b_sbr01 to BOBLIST.n.PSTIND

2011004017 - slc - 11/02/2011 - added edit for Blue on Blue to catch critical failure type issues that would prevent us routing the claim on to next LOB.
